forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is draped in a soft blanket of clouds, evoking a refreshing yet muted charm typical of early June. As sunset draws near, the chill of the evening beckons. Current temperatures hover around the lower 60s, a gentle reminder to layer up. The occasional whisper of drizzle, lingering like distant memories, dissipates as the day unfolds, leaving a stage set for muted sunshine to break through the cloud cover. There’s a hint of the marine layer still clinging to the hills, gently suggesting a dance between land and sea.

As the winds blow from the west-southwest, carrying the salty air of the bay, they invite you to step outside and partake in the city’s understated beauty. With gusts reaching up to 29 mph, a light jacket will serve as a faithful companion to shield you from the brisk breezes. An afternoon stroll along the waterfront could be just the remedy for the soul, as the San Francisco scenery transforms under the fading light—viewing the elegant silhouettes of the Golden Gate Bridge framed by low-hanging clouds might just capture your heart. Alternatively, a quiet afternoon in a local café, cradling a warm cup, would be an excellent way to embrace the day’s ambiance, allowing fleeting moments to unravel while the city pulses with its typical vibrancy.
